titleStmt.title: The Students of Ram-Ally to the AVTHOR.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: The Students of Ram-Ally to the AVTHOR.

monogr.title: VVheresoeuer you see mee, trust vnto your selfe. Or, The mysterie of lending and borrowing : Seria iocis: or, the tickling torture. By Thomas Povvel, London-Cambrian
monogr.author: Powell, Thomas

div.head: The Students of Ram-Ally to the AVTHOR.

lg.l: IF all be true that men speake a their knowledge,
Your selfe was sometimes fellow of a Colledge
Within Ram-Ally: and you should doe well,
To come and take a place that late befell:
(To tell you true) it is the welsh Professour,
Your pulpit shall be Robin Gibbes his Dresser.
If you stand for the Lecture, feare not speeding,
For then w'are like to haue a merry reeding.

closer.dateline: From the Horse-shooe, this first of May, 1623.
